intro: Valerianella pontica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved valerian, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing herb with small, bright green leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer and is often found in moist, grassy areas. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine. Valerianella pontica is also known for its pleasant, slightly spicy fragrance.
